content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

### Hints

1. Start by defining an `instance Show FloatWithUnits where` and then write the body of the `show` method inside, but don't forget to include a type declaration!
2. Don't forget that in order to format a float with only one decimal place you will need to use `:.1f`, which we covered before.
3. If you need to, consult the [Float documentation](https://hackage.haskell.org/package/base-4.9.0.0/docs/Prelude.html#t:Float) from GHCi. It can be very helpful!
